text:
346, 350-352-354 West 40th Street, south side, east of Ninth Avenue. No. 346, here erroneously labeled 350, is a former German Methodist-Episcopal Church which has just been taken over by the Greek Orthodox Congregation of Saints Constantine and Helen.

June, 1929.

350, 346, 344 West 40th Street, south side, east of Ninth Avenue. No. 346 is the Greek Orthodox Church of Saints Constantine and Helen, which took this edifice over in 1925. (See 346-354 West 40th Street, June 1925). The edifice is shortly to give way to a six-story garage.

May 23, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

A view of the two three-story frame houses in the rear of Nos. 403-405 West 40th Street, north side, just west of Ninth Avenue.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

A view of the three-story frame house in the rear of 422 West 40th Street, south side, west of Ninth Avenue.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York, Negative No. 510

A view of the three-story frame house in the rear of No.422 West 40th Street, south side, west of Ninth Avenue.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

404-418 West 40th Street, south side, west of Ninth Ave. Shown at Nos. 408-412, is the St. Clemen's R.C. Church and School.

August 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

August 30, 1934.

403-405 West 40th Street, west of the N.W. corner of Ninth Ave., as seen from clearance on 41st Street. Building concerned is a 3-story frame house.

May 11, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

West 40th Street (the immediate foreground) north side, between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, showing a clearance between this point and West 41st Street. This, in conjunction with the buildings on the north side of the latter point will form a portion of the new Dyer Avenue, the approach to the new Lincoln Tunnel. The loft building seen in the left background is on the north side of 42nd Street and will remain, to face the northern extremity of this vehicular roadway.

March 18, 1935.

P. L. Sperr,

Peddlers, Fruit: A market scene on Ninth Ave., near West 40th street, showing a retail general produce area. This is a set of 2 views. 1936.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Fruit.

text:
Ninth Ave., east side, north from West 40th Street and showing a portion of a retail market area known popularly as "Paddys MarƗket": which in the near future will disappear as same; the Lincoln Tunnel traffic necessitating the removal of obstructions.

December 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

Alec Phobshat # 21076
